subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Monday, 21 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Morgan agrees takeover of Wolves
Sir Jack Hayward is to sell 100% of the shares in Wolves to Steve Morgan for only £10 - on the condition £30m is invested in the club.



 
Robson to be named Blades manager
Sheffield United will name Bryan Robson as their new manager, according to BBC Five Live.



 
Eriksson backs England to qualify
Sven-Goran Eriksson talks about England's past and future and his treatment by the media in an interview with BBC One's Inside Sport.








GOLF




Harrington eyes Wentworth bonus
Newly-crowned Irish Open champion Padraig Harrington is targeting a £680,000 bonus this week in the BMW PGA Championship.



 
Harrington claims Irish Open win
Padraig Harrington becomes the first home winner of the Irish Open in 25 years after beating Bradley Dredge in a play-off.



 
Johnson captures Atlanta Classic
Masters champion Zach Johnson wins a sudden-death play-off against Japan's Ryuji Imada to take the Atlanta Classic in Georgia.








MOTORSPORT




Hamilton plays down Monaco hopes
Lewis Hamilton says he is "realistic" about winning the Monaco Grand Prix on his Formula One debut in the Principality.



 
China's F1 track chief dismissed
The head of China's Formula One track and two others are fired over Shanghai's ongoing pension corruption scandal.



 
Vermeulen wins in rainy Le Mans
Suzuki's Chris Vermeulen wins a rain-swept French MotoGP at Le Mans.








FORMULA ONE




Hamilton plays down Monaco hopes
Lewis Hamilton says he is "realistic" about winning the Monaco Grand Prix on his Formula One debut in the Principality.



 
China's F1 track chief dismissed
The head of China's Formula One track and two others are fired over Shanghai's ongoing pension corruption scandal.



 
Mosley steps up push for green F1
Formula One boss Max Mosley is proposing a raft of changes to help accelerate the adoption of "green" technology.








ATHLETICS




Pavey races to Manchester victory
Britain's Jo Pavey produces a world-class performance to win the Great Manchester Run.



 
Sayers sets new UK javelin record
Goldie Sayers breaks the British javelin record with a throw of 65.05m at the Loughborough International meeting.



 
GB trio shine in Great Wall test
Britain has three top-10 finishers in China's Great Wall Marathon as Salvador Calvo smashes the record in one of the world's toughest 26-mile races.








CYCLING




Napolitano dashes to Giro victory
Danilo Napolitano wins a mass sprint to claim the ninth stage of the Giro d'Italia.



 
Landis denies doping at hearing
Floyd Landis again denies taking performance-enhancing drugs at a hearing in Malibu.



 
Arvesen claims eighth Giro stage
Norwegian Kurt Asle Arvesen snatches the eighth stage of the Giro d'Italia beating world champion Paolo Bettini in a sprint finish.








FUN AND GAMES




Victory is sweet for Pete
Pete Doherty scores the winner as his side win football event



 
Comment: Cup of little cheer
Robbo gives his verdict on "dull" FA Cup final 



 
Review of the week
Movie legend to strip if team go up, as the hunt for Mourinho's dog goes on
